Description: Ostracon, fragment of the upper body of a light-brown pottery ribbed vessel, with base of one handle surviving, the fabric is partially grey-black in section, the exterior is covered with a self-slip and remains of one line of incised Coptic text.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (394176) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/394176)
